1.text: Make a paste of baking soda and water.

2.text: Spray the baking soda paste with a vinegar solution.

3.text: Wait for the solution to stop bubbling.

4.text: Scrub the grout lines with a brush.

5.text: Mop the floor with plain water.

6.text: Dissolve 2 tablespoons of oxygenated bleach into 2 cups of warm water.

7.text: Test a hidden corner of the grout before cleaning the entire floor.

8.text: Pour the oxygen bleach solution onto the grout.

9.text: Use a nylon bristle brush to scrub the oxygen bleach solution into the grout lines.

10.text: Dip the brush into the oxygenated bleach powder to increase cleaning power.

11.text: Rinse the floor with water and dry.

13.text: Apply the paste with a nylon-bristled brush.

14.text: Let the mixture sit on the grout for 15 minutes.

15.text: Rinse the grout with warm or hot water to remove all of the solution.

16.text: Use a rag to wipe the grout to remove any leftover residue or dirt.

17.text: Mop the floor with clean water.

18.text: Rent or purchase a steam cleaner.

19.text: Follow the manufacturer’s directions to assemble and fill the steam cleaner.

20.text: Fill the reservoir with clean water to the fill line according to the manual’s instructions.

21.text: Turn the steam cleaner on and allow it to heat up.

22.text: Move the cleaning brush back and forth over the grout.

23.text: Use a towel or mop to wipe up the excess moisture after cleaning.
